column4: Help: Gparted on my Ubuntu LIVECD cannot resize my linux partition..How can I fix that?
HAve you unmounted the partition
Iunno. How can I do that?
right click the partition and select unmount
is this wrong? v4l2:// :v4l2-dev=/dev/video0 :v4l2-adev= :v4l2-standard=0
Please ask your question in channel and dont direct your question to individuals that have not offered to help
Repeating is not necessary and wont get you help any sooner
Accident D: Can you help tho?
Please  have patience and wait for an answer, repost the queastion every few minutes or rephrase it if you are not getting an answer
I'm going crazy with this, Ubuntu has been nothing but a problem thus far ..
Are you the only user in your system
Yeah, why?
Just wanted to make  sure your user had burn rights to the cd
Should I sudo k3b and see if it can read it?
give it a shot
Should the light on my drive stay lit?
I would not think so
Nope, not detected as root, any where else I can look to see if Xubuntu itself can detect it?
does your bios see it
Not a clue, how do I check?
on boot it should show up, can the drive read a regular cd..
Yeah, no problem watching House on it, so it can even read DVDs.
k3b and brasero .. neither see it as a burner.. so no idea other than try a different brand of disk
